item.title: Trial - Code of Reality - Jan 20, 2025
item.dc:creator: participant
item.content:encoded:
Trial Description

This trial followed the Code of Reality Protocol exactly as specified. After two medium inhales of N,N-DMT, I observed the laser diffraction pattern projected on a flat closet door.

Observations

Within approximately 30 seconds after the second inhale, I began to notice subtle movements within the laser diffraction lines. As the effects intensified, the lines appeared to contain flowing symbols that resembled Japanese Katakana or some form of alien writing system. The symbols moved in a consistent direction, appearing to flow from left to right along the diffraction lines.

The symbols maintained their coherence regardless of my head movements or changes in perspective. They appeared to be an intrinsic property of the light itself rather than a subjective visual distortion.

Most interestingly, when I closed my eyes and reopened them, the same pattern of symbols would reappear in the same location, suggesting a stable phenomenon rather than random hallucination.

Additional Notes

The phenomenon lasted approximately 10 minutes before gradually fading. I was able to sketch some of the symbols immediately after the experience, though my artistic abilities may not fully capture the complexity of what I observed.

There were no additional observers present during this trial.
item.excerpt:encoded: This trial followed the Code of Reality Protocol exactly as specified. After two medium inhales of N,N-DMT, I observed the laser diffraction pattern projected on a flat closet door.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Two medium inhales from a vape pen as specified in the protocol. The DMT was vaporized at approximately 180째C.
Two medium inhales from a vape pen as specified in the protocol. The DMT was vaporized at approximately 180째C.
Two medium inhales from a vape pen as specified in the protocol. The DMT was vaporized at approximately 180째C.
Alex Johnson
alex.j@example.com
Highly interested since reading Nick Bostrom's paper. I've been exploring the intersection of consciousness and reality simulation for about 3 years.
Reddit r/Psychonaut community post
The beam appeared to expand and contract rhythmically. The edges became more defined and seemed to contain microscopic structures.

Symbols resembled a combination of Japanese Katakana and cuneiform writing. They appeared to be organized in sequences of 3-7 characters, repeating in patterns. Some symbols transformed into others while maintaining structural similarity.
Left to right, occasionally pulsing in and out of the projection surface

There was a distinct geometric framework underlying the symbols, like a grid or lattice that the characters were anchored to. When focusing on individual symbols, they seemed to contain smaller versions of similar patterns (fractal-like).
Two medium inhales from a vape pen as specified in the protocol. The DMT was vaporized at approximately 180째C.

Highly interested since reading Nick Bostrom's paper. I've been exploring the intersection of consciousness and reality simulation for about 3 years.

The beam appeared to expand and contract rhythmically. The edges became more defined and seemed to contain microscopic structures.

Symbols resembled a combination of Japanese Katakana and cuneiform writing. They appeared to be organized in sequences of 3-7 characters, repeating in patterns. Some symbols transformed into others while maintaining structural similarity.
Left to right, occasionally pulsing in and out of the projection surface

There was a distinct geometric framework underlying the symbols, like a grid or lattice that the characters were anchored to. When focusing on individual symbols, they seemed to contain smaller versions of similar patterns (fractal-like).

item.title: Trial - Code of Reality - Jan 28, 2025
item.dc:creator: hopefuladmin
item.content:encoded:
Trial Description

This trial followed the Code of Reality Protocol with a slight variation in the laser power, which was measured at 0.9 mW instead of the specified 1.0 mW due to battery depletion.

Observations

After administering the DMT as specified in the protocol, I observed the laser diffraction pattern for approximately 15 minutes. The initial effects were subtle, with a slight "breathing" quality to the laser lines. As the DMT effects intensified (approximately 45 seconds after the second inhale), distinct symbols began to appear within the diffraction lines.

The symbols appeared to be organized in a coherent pattern, flowing along the lines in a consistent direction. They resembled a combination of geometric shapes and alphabetic characters, somewhat similar to cuneiform or ancient writing systems. The symbols maintained their position relative to the diffraction pattern regardless of my viewing angle or head position.

Most notably, certain symbols appeared to repeat in specific sequences, suggesting a form of language or code rather than random visual noise. I was able to identify at least three distinct "characters" that appeared multiple times in what seemed to be specific arrangements.

Additional Notes

Despite the slightly lower laser power than specified in the protocol, the phenomenon was clearly observable. This suggests that the effect may be robust across minor variations in equipment specifications.

One additional observer was present during this trial but did not participate in the DMT administration. They reported being able to see the laser diffraction pattern normally but did not observe any symbols or unusual patterns within the light.
item.excerpt:encoded: This trial followed the Code of Reality Protocol with a slight variation in the laser power, which was measured at 0.9 mW instead of the specified 1.0 mW due to battery depletion.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Two medium inhales from a vape pen as specified. The second inhale was held for approximately 20 seconds.
Two medium inhales from a vape pen as specified. The second inhale was held for approximately 20 seconds.
Two medium inhales from a vape pen as specified. The second inhale was held for approximately 20 seconds.
Chris Walters
c.walters@example.com
Moderate interest. I find the philosophical implications fascinating.
Academic colleague referral
Circular dot with slight diffraction pattern
AAA batteries (fresh Energizer)
Quiet room with minimal ambient light. Calm mindset after 20 minutes of meditation. One trusted friend present as observer/sitter.
Near complete darkness with only a small red LED night light in far corner of room
White matte wall
No other substances within 72 hours of experiment. Last caffeine consumption was 8 hours prior.
Strong geometric visuals with eyes closed. Enhanced pattern recognition. Time dilation. Sense of presence/entities. Maintained cognitive clarity throughout experience.
The beam appeared to develop a pulsating quality and seemed to expand beyond its physical boundaries.
Geometric glyphs with some resemblance to ancient writing systems. Three distinct symbols appeared repeatedly in specific sequences.
Left to right along diffraction lines
Two medium inhales from a vape pen as specified. The second inhale was held for approximately 20 seconds.

Quiet room with minimal ambient light. Calm mindset after 20 minutes of meditation. One trusted friend present as observer/sitter.
Near complete darkness with only a small red LED night light in far corner of room
White matte wall
No other substances within 72 hours of experiment. Last caffeine consumption was 8 hours prior.
Strong geometric visuals with eyes closed. Enhanced pattern recognition. Time dilation. Sense of presence/entities. Maintained cognitive clarity throughout experience.
The beam appeared to develop a pulsating quality and seemed to expand beyond its physical boundaries.
Geometric glyphs with some resemblance to ancient writing systems. Three distinct symbols appeared repeatedly in specific sequences.
Left to right along diffraction lines
Two medium inhales from a vape pen as specified. The second inhale was held for approximately 20 seconds.
Chris Walters
c.walters@example.com
Moderate interest. I find the philosophical implications fascinating.
Academic colleague referral
